info.title: Django CFG API
info.description: Complete API documentation for Django CFG Demo Project

get.description: Get all OAuth connections for the current user.

post.description: Remove OAuth connection for the specified provider.
Generate GitHub OAuth authorization URL. Redirect user to this URL to start authentication.
Exchange authorization code for JWT tokens. Call this after GitHub redirects back with code.

get.description: Get list of available OAuth providers for authentication.

post.description: Request OTP code to email or phone.

Verify OTP code and return JWT tokens or 2FA session.

If user has 2FA enabled:
- Returns requires_2fa=True with session_id
- Client must complete 2FA verification at /cfg/totp/verify/

If user has no 2FA:
- Returns JWT tokens and user data directly

get.description: Retrieve the current authenticated user's profile information.

post.description: Upload avatar image for the current authenticated user. Accepts multipart/form-data with 'avatar' field.

avatar.description: Avatar image file (JPEG, PNG, GIF, WebP, max 5MB)

post.description:
Permanently delete the current user's account.

    This operation:
    - Deactivates the account (user cannot log in)
    - Anonymizes personal data (GDPR compliance)
    - Frees up the email address for re-registration
    - Preserves audit trail

    The account can be restored by an administrator if needed.

put.description: Partially update the current authenticated user's profile information. Supports avatar upload.

patch.description: Partially update the current authenticated user's profile information. Supports avatar upload.

put.description: Update the current authenticated user's profile information.

patch.description: Update the current authenticated user's profile information.

post.description: Refresh JWT token.

get.description: Generate JWT token for WebSocket connection to Centrifugo. Token includes user's allowed channels based on their permissions. Requires authentication.
Returns statistics grouped by channel.
Returns the current health status of the Centrifugo client.
Returns overview statistics for Centrifugo publishes.
Returns a paginated list of recent Centrifugo publishes with their details. Uses standard DRF pagination.

Returns server information including node count, version, and uptime.
Returns list of clients currently subscribed to a channel.
Returns quick statistics about channel presence (num_clients, num_users).
Publish test message to Centrifugo via wrapper with optional ACK tracking.
Publish message using CentrifugoClient with database logging. This will create CentrifugoLog records.
Manually send ACK for a message to the wrapper. Pass message_id in request body.

get.description: Retrieve commands summary with statistics and categorization
Retrieve user's DjangoConfig settings and complete Django settings (sanitized)

Retrieve metrics from all or specific categories.

**Available Categories:**
- `llm_balances` - LLM provider API keys and account balances
- `system_health` - Database, cache, queue health status
- `api_stats` - API usage statistics (coming soon)

**Query Parameters:**
- `categories` - Comma-separated list of categories (optional)
- `force` - Force refresh, bypass cache (default: false)

Get LLM provider balances and API key status.

**Providers:**
- OpenAI - API key validation (balance check unavailable)
- OpenRouter - Prepaid credit balance

**Status Levels:**
- `ok` - Balance above $10 or API key valid
- `warning` - Balance between $5-$10
- `critical` - Balance below $5
- `error` - API key invalid or request failed

Get system component health status.

**Components:**
- Database - PostgreSQL/MySQL connectivity
- Cache - Redis/Memcached status
- Queue - RQ/Celery worker status (if available)
Retrieve complete dashboard data including stats, health, actions, and metrics
Retrieve statistics for all enabled django-cfg applications

get.description: Returns detailed information about a specific job.

delete.description: Deletes a job from the queue.

post.description: Cancels a job. For queued jobs, cancels immediately. For running jobs, sets cancellation flag for cooperative cancellation. Use force=true to send SIGTERM (dangerous).

parameters.name: force
parameters.description: Force stop by sending SIGTERM to worker (dangerous, kills all jobs on worker)

schema.description: Job not found or already finished

post.description: Requeues a failed job.

delete.description:
Delete a TOTP device.

Requires verification code if removing the last/primary device.

post.description:
Completely disable 2FA for account.

Requires verification code.

Start 2FA setup process.

Creates a new TOTP device and returns QR code for scanning.

Confirm 2FA setup with first valid code.

Activates the device and generates backup codes.

Verify TOTP code for 2FA session.

Completes authentication and returns JWT tokens on success.

Verify backup recovery code for 2FA session.

Alternative verification method when TOTP device unavailable.

success.description: Whether the account was successfully deleted

masked_key.description: Masked API key (first 4 and last 4 chars)

is_valid.description: Whether key is valid (active and not expired)

request_count.description: Total requests made with this key

Command.description:
Django management command serializer.

Includes security metadata from base classes (SafeCommand, InteractiveCommand, etc.):
- web_executable: Can be executed via web interface
- requires_input: Requires interactive user input
- is_destructive: Modifies or deletes data

web_executable.description: Can be executed via web interface

command.description: Name of the Django management command

ConfigData.description:
Serializer for complete config data endpoint.

Returns both DjangoConfig and Django settings with validation info.

django_settings.description: Complete Django settings (sanitized, contains mixed types)

_validation.title: validation
_validation.description: Validation result comparing serializer with actual config

missing_in_serializer.description: Fields present in config but missing in serializer

extra_in_serializer.description: Fields present in serializer but not in config

ConfirmSetupRequest.description: Serializer for confirming 2FA setup with first code.

backup_codes.description: List of backup recovery codes (save these!)

ConnectionTokenResponse.description: Response model for Centrifugo connection token.
ConnectionTokenResponse.title: ConnectionTokenResponse

status.description: Overall health status: healthy, degraded, or unhealthy

checks.description: Detailed health checks for databases, cache, and system

Main serializer for dashboard overview endpoint.
Uses typed serializers for proper OpenAPI schema generation.

extensions.description: Installed extensions info for menu filtering

DeviceListResponse.description: Response serializer for device list endpoint.

DjangoConfig.description:
Typed serializer for user's DjangoConfig settings.

Reflects the actual structure of DjangoConfig model.
All passwords and sensitive data are sanitized before reaching this serializer.

ExtensionInfo.description: Extension information for frontend menu filtering.

success_rate.description: Success rate percentage for this service

services.description: List of registered services with stats

GRPCServiceInfo.description: Information about a single gRPC service.

count.description: Number of records in this model

redirect_uri.description: URL to redirect after OAuth authorization. If not provided, uses config's site_url + callback_path

source_url.description: Optional source URL for registration tracking

authorization_url.description: Full URL to redirect user to OAuth provider

state.description: State token for CSRF protection. Store this and verify on callback.

OAuthCallbackRequestRequest.description: Request to complete OAuth flow (callback handler).

code.description: Authorization code from OAuth provider callback

state.description: State token for CSRF verification (from authorize response)

redirect_uri.description: Same redirect_uri used in authorize request. If not provided, uses config's site_url + callback_path

provider.description:
OAuth provider name (github, google, etc.)

* `github` - GitHub

provider_username.description: Username on the OAuth provider platform

provider_email.description: Email from OAuth provider (may differ from user.email)

connected_at.description: When this OAuth connection was created

last_login_at.description: Last time this OAuth connection was used for login

OAuthTokenResponse.description:
Response with JWT tokens after OAuth authentication.

When 2FA is required:
- requires_2fa: True
- session_id: UUID of 2FA verification session
- access/refresh/user: null

When 2FA is not required:
- requires_2fa: False
- session_id: null
- access/refresh/user: populated

is_new_user.description: True if a new user was created during this OAuth flow

is_new_connection.description: True if a new OAuth connection was created

should_prompt_2fa.description: True if user should be prompted to enable 2FA

identifier.description: Email address or phone number for OTP delivery

channel.description:
Delivery channel: 'email' or 'phone'. Auto-detected if not provided.

* `email` - Email
* `phone` - Phone

source_url.description: Source URL for tracking registration (e.g., https://my.djangocfg.com)

identifier.description: Email address or phone number used for OTP request

channel.description:
Delivery channel: 'email' or 'phone'. Auto-detected if not provided.

* `email` - Email
* `phone` - Phone

source_url.description: Source URL for tracking login (e.g., https://my.djangocfg.com)

OTPVerifyResponse.description:
OTP verification response.

When 2FA is required:
- requires_2fa: True
- session_id: UUID of 2FA verification session
- refresh/access/user: null

When 2FA is not required:
- requires_2fa: False
- session_id: null
- refresh/access/user: populated

refresh.description: JWT refresh token (if requires_2fa is False)

access.description: JWT access token (if requires_2fa is False)

should_prompt_2fa.description: Whether user should be prompted to enable 2FA

* `memory` - memory
* `cpu` - cpu

args.description: Task arguments (array of any JSON values)

ScheduleCreateRequest.description:
Serializer for creating a scheduled job.

Supports three scheduling methods:
1. scheduled_time: Schedule job at specific time
2. interval: Schedule job to repeat at intervals
3. cron: Schedule job with cron expression

args.description: Function arguments (array of any JSON values)

queue_name.description: Queue name to schedule job in

interval.description: Schedule job to repeat every N seconds

cron.description: Cron expression (e.g., '0 0 * * *' for daily at midnight)

repeat.description: Number of times to repeat (None = infinite)

args.description: Function arguments (array of any JSON values)

device_id.description: Device ID to use for confirmation

provisioning_uri.description: otpauth:// URI for QR code generation
